meanings.definition: A fraudulent or dishonest act or practice
meanings.sent1: The store selling fake designer bags was a ripoff.
meanings.sent2: I felt like I was a victim of a ripoff when I realized the product was fake.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was a ripoff, but it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist was a ripoff master, deceiving many innocent people.
meanings.sent5: The ripoff scheme was so cunning that it fooled even the experts.

meanings.definition: Something that is overpriced or of poor quality
meanings.sent1: The cheaply made toy was a ripoff at that high price.
meanings.sent2: I regret buying that ripoff of a product; it broke after one use.
meanings.sent3: The so-called 'luxury' hotel turned out to be a ripoff with dirty rooms.
meanings.sent4: The overpriced meal was a ripoff, leaving me hungry and disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The ripoff sunglasses fell apart after just a few days of use.
